results.content:
Great introductory course. Antonio has a good teaching style and provides clear and concise explanations. I had to play at 1.25x sometimes due to slow pace and would also love to have gradle commands included in the course as not everyone loves or works with maven.

Highly recommended course if you are starting with Quarkus.
results.content_html:
Great introductory course. Antonio has a good teaching style and provides clear and concise explanations. I had to play at 1.25x sometimes due to slow pace and would also love to have gradle commands included in the course as not everyone loves or works with maven.

Highly recommended course if you are starting with Quarkus.

results.content:
I've been hearing about Quarkus for few years now but I had never taken the time to check what it was all about.

This lesson gives a global overview of Quarkus principles, with hands-on practice coding.

The author is really engaging, speaks well, and explains things clearly.

After following this course, I definitely want to know more about this amazing framework. 

Thank you Antonio for this amazing course, I'm really looking forward to your other course on Quarkus + Microservices.

C'était vraiment au top, Merci encore !

Cheers!

Ariel

results.content: I really liked the course in every aspect, although i am not very familiar with some technologies used in this course, but it was worthy to follow the course as i will be using this knowledge for my future assignments, i would have liked even more if the slides were available, but the source code in author's GitHub account makes up for that. Really great !!

results.content:
clear, easy and straightforward.
Love classes where the instructor teaches not only the technology about the topic but also gives us the broader picture of all other alternatives: frameworks/build tools/pkg managers,etc. while also comparing their performances. thank you

results.content: This course is an excellent introduction into Quarkus. Antonio clearly explains Quarkus on an elementary level and does it splendidly. If you have higher expectations, you might be a bit disappointed (but he is very clear about this at the start).

response.content: Thanks Rudolf for your kind words. Indeed, this is a beginners course... but I'm working on more advanced ones ;o) Stay tuned
